name: Cox's Bazar
description: Cox's Bazar is a town on the southeast coast of Bangladesh. It's known for its long, sandy beach and is a popular destination for both domestic and international tourists.
highlights: Visit the Cox's Bazar beach, the longest natural beach in the world
Explore the Himchori waterfall and its surrounding natural beauty
Take a boat ride on the Bay of Bengal to see St. Martin's Island
Visit the Buddhist temple of Ramu for a glimpse of local culture

name: Sundarbans
description: The Sundarbans is a mangrove forest in the coastal region of Bangladesh. It's known for its unique biodiversity, including the Bengal tiger, and is a UNESCO World Heritage Site.
highlights: Take a boat tour of the mangrove forest to see wildlife like the Bengal tiger and crocodiles
Visit the Katka and Kachikhali wildlife sanctuaries for birdwatching and more wildlife sightings
Explore the small villages and fishing communities within the Sundarbans
Learn about the local honey-collecting industry and try some honey

name: Rangamati
description: Rangamati is a town in the hilly region of southeastern Bangladesh. It's known for its natural beauty, including hills, lakes, and waterfalls, as well as its indigenous communities.
highlights: Visit the Kaptai Lake and take a boat ride to see the surrounding hills and forests
Explore the Rajbonbihar Buddhist temple and its peaceful surroundings
Visit the indigenous communities and learn about their unique culture and crafts
Hike to the Boga Lake for a stunning view of the surrounding hills
